newsitem.title: FRANCE: Jospin meets French unions, employers Weds/Thurs.
newsitem.headline: Jospin meets French unions, employers Weds/Thurs.

text.p: French Socialist Prime Minister Lionel Jospin will meet trade union and employer representatives on Wednesday and Thursday, the prime minister's office said.
The first meeting will be with Force Ouvriere union leader Marc Blondel at 1345 GMT on Wednesday, followed by talks at 1415 GMT with Marc Vilbenoit, leader of the white-collar CGC union.

A meeting with Communist-led CGT union boss Louis Viannet will take place on Thursday at 1415 GMT, followed by one with CFTC boss Alain Deleu, after which Jospin will meet Jean Gandois, head of the CNPF employers' organisation, and Daniel Giron, head of the UPA small trades organisation.

Jospin then meets Lucien Rebuffel, head of an organisation representing small and medium sized companies, and his last meeting will be with CFDT trade union leader Nicole Notat from 1630 GMT to 1715 GMT.
